questions.question: The concept of 'Rule of Law' primarily means that:

options.B: Everyone, including government officials, is subject to the law
options.C: Laws only apply to ordinary citizens
options.D: The government can change laws without notice

questions.question: Which of the following is a key component of the Rule of Law?

options.B: Supremacy of the Constitution
options.C: Unlimited power of the Prime Minister

questions.question: A society without a rule of law usually leads to:

options.B: Anarchy and the rule of force

questions.question: The judiciary is the branch of government responsible for:

options.B: Interpreting and applying the law
options.C: Enforcing the law through the police

questions.question: For the Rule of Law to be effective, the judiciary must be:

options.B: Independent and impartial

questions.question: Which document is considered the supreme law of Ethiopia?

options.B: The FDRE Constitution

questions.question: The principle that 'Justice delayed is justice denied' refers to:

options.B: Slow court processes that harm the parties involved
options.D: Laws being written in foreign languages

questions.question: Which of the following describes 'Equality before the law'?

options.A: Everyone must have the same income
options.B: The law treats all people the same regardless of status
options.C: Only rich people can win in court

questions.question: The legal protection that prevents a person from being arrested without a valid reason is:

options.B: Habeas Corpus

questions.question: The role of the 'Prosecutor' in a criminal trial is to:

options.B: Bring charges against the suspect on behalf of the state
options.D: Report the news to the public

questions.question: Corruption in the legal system is a threat to the Rule of Law because it:

options.B: Undermines public trust and equality

questions.question: The difference between 'Law' and 'Ethics' is that:

options.A: Laws are written and enforced by the state; ethics are internal moral principles
options.B: Ethics are more important than laws
options.C: Only laws exist in a democracy

questions.question: One of the sources of the FDRE Constitution is:

options.B: The history and struggles of the Ethiopian people
options.D: The personal will of the President

questions.question: A 'Transparent' legal system is one where:

options.B: Legal proceedings and laws are clear and accessible to the public
options.C: Only lawyers can see the laws

questions.question: The FDRE Constitution divides the Ethiopian court system into:

options.B: Military and Civil courts only
options.D: One single court for the whole country

questions.question: The highest court in Ethiopia is the:

options.B: Federal Supreme Court

questions.question: According to the FDRE Constitution, the power to interpret the Constitution belongs to:

options.B: The House of Federation

questions.question: The phrase 'Ignorance of the law is no excuse' means:

options.A: You don't need to study law
options.B: A person is still liable for a crime even if they didn't know it was illegal
options.C: Laws are only for those who go to school
options.D: Police must teach you the law before arresting you

questions.question: When a person is accused of a crime, they are 'Presumed Innocent' until:

options.B: Proven guilty in a court of law
options.C: The newspaper says they are guilty

questions.question: A fair trial requires that the accused has the right to:

options.B: Legal representation (a lawyer)
options.D: Pay the victim to go away

questions.question: What is the primary objective of 'International Law'?

options.A: To make all countries follow one king
options.B: To regulate relations between sovereign states
options.D: To collect taxes from all people

questions.question: Human Rights are 'Inalienable', which means:

options.B: They cannot be taken away or given up

questions.question: Which of the following is a 'Civil' law case?

options.B: A contract dispute between two businessmen

questions.question: In a democracy, the military is typically:

options.B: Under civilian control and subject to the law

questions.question: The UDHR (Universal Declaration of Human Rights) was adopted by:

options.B: The United Nations

questions.question: Social justice refers to:

options.B: The fair distribution of wealth, opportunities, and privileges in society
options.C: Everyone having the same amount of money in their pocket

questions.question: Administrative law deals with the actions of:

options.B: Government agencies and departments

questions.question: The 'Ombudsman' helps protect the Rule of Law by:

options.B: Investigating complaints against government officials

questions.question: The term 'Limited Government' means:

options.A: The government has very few employees
options.B: Government power is restricted by law and the Constitution
options.C: The government only works for a few hours

questions.question: Accountability means that government officials must:

options.B: Be responsible for their actions and answerable to the public

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an unethical but NOT illegal act?

options.B: Lying to a friend for personal gain

questions.question: The main purpose of 'Punishment' in a modern legal system is:

options.B: Deterrence, protection of society, and rehabilitation
options.C: To make money for the government
options.D: To show the power of the judge

questions.question: The 'Supremacy Clause' of the Ethiopian Constitution is found in Article:
Which body ensures that regional laws do not contradict the Federal Constitution?

options.B: The Constitutional Inquiry Council

questions.question: The 'Power of Judicial Review' allows courts to:

options.A: Change the results of an election
options.B: Declare laws or executive acts unconstitutional

questions.question: The principle of 'Separation of Powers' supports the Rule of Law by:

options.A: Concentrating all power in one person
options.B: Creating a system of checks and balances
options.C: Making the law harder to understand

questions.question: A 'Plaintiff' is the person who:

options.B: Initiates a lawsuit in a civil case

questions.question: What is the 'Bar' in the legal profession?

options.A: The place where prisoners are kept
options.B: The professional organization of lawyers

questions.question: Public law regulates the relationship between:

options.B: The individual and the state

questions.question: The right to 'Due Process' ensures that:

options.B: Legal proceedings are conducted fairly and according to established rules
options.D: Laws apply differently to different people

questions.question: A 'Customary Law' is based on:

options.B: Long-established practices and traditions of a community

questions.question: The 'Rule of Law' helps in economic development by:

options.A: Providing stability and protecting property rights
options.B: Ensuring the government owns everything

questions.question: Which of the following violates the Rule of Law?

options.A: Arresting someone with a court warrant
options.B: A government official using their position to bypass the law
options.C: Filing a lawsuit against the government
options.D: Publishing a law in the official gazette

questions.question: The 'Negarit Gazeta' is important because it is where:

options.B: Laws are officially published to become effective
options.C: The history of the war is written

questions.question: Ethical codes for professionals (like doctors or lawyers) are designed to:

options.B: Ensure high standards of conduct and protect the public
options.D: Allow them to ignore the law

questions.question: The 'Universal Declaration of Human Rights' (UDHR) consists of how many articles?
Legal 'Sanctions' are:

options.B: Penalties imposed for violating the law

questions.question: The principle of 'Majority Rule' must never be used to:

options.B: Violate the fundamental rights of minorities

questions.question: The 'International Court of Justice' (ICJ) is located in:

options.B: The Hague, Netherlands

questions.question: Civic participation in the Rule of Law includes:

options.A: Taking the law into your own hands
options.B: Respecting the law and helping in the administration of justice
